component.text:
• The slowest and most widely available service.
  • Uses regular voice-grade telephone lines.

• Service available through Cellular telephone providers.
  • Relatively slow access speeds but becoming more common.

• Service available from most telephone companies.
  • Provides high speed digital connection over regular telephone lines.

• Service available from most cable companies.
  • Provides high speed connection over the cable TV network.

• Service available from Internet dish satellite companies.
  • Provides medium speeds via satellite.
  • Satellite may be the only choice faster than dial-up in some rural areas.

• Service available from most telephone companies.
  • Provides high speed connection over dedicated digital data lines.
  • The most common example of a leased line is a T1. Primarily for business-class service.
Roll over each picture to get a description of the type of connection.
